title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Part (a): 1 point is earned for a description of the process used in a parliamentary system for the selection of the chief executive. An acceptable description includes the following:

  • The head of the majority party becomes prime minister. 

    • If a majority exists, the head of the party becomes the prime minister.

    • If no majority exists, the largest minority party usually names the prime minister in a coalition government.

Note: No point is earned for “legislature selects the executive” without reference to party or coalition.
descriptions:
The student failed to provide a correct description.

An acceptable description includes the following: 

  • The head of the majority party becomes prime minister. 

    • If a majority exists, the head of the party becomes the prime minister.

    • If no majority exists, the largest minority party usually names the prime minister in a coalition government.

The student earn one point for a description of the process used in a parliamentary system for the selection of the chief executive.

An acceptable description includes the following: 

  • The head of the majority party becomes prime minister. 

    • If a majority exists, the head of the party becomes the prime minister.

    • If no majority exists, the largest minority party usually names the prime minister in a coalition government.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Part (b): 1 point is earned for a correct contrast of the process described in part (a) with the process used in a presidential system for the selection of the chief executive. An acceptable contrast includes the following:

  • Parliamentary — legislature selects the head of government.

  • Presidential — executive is chosen separately from legislature.

  • The people elect the president.

Note: Parts (a) and (b) may be read together. The response must demonstrate that the executive and legislature are fused in a parliamentary system and not fused in a presidential system.
descriptions:
The student failed to provide a correct response, an acceptable contrast includes the following:

  • Parliamentary — legislature selects the head of government.

  • Presidential — executive is chosen separately from legislature.

  • The people elect the president.

The student provided a correct response, an acceptable contrast includes the following:

  • Parliamentary — legislature selects the head of government.

  • Presidential — executive is chosen separately from legislature.

  • The people elect the president.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Part (c): 1 point is earned for a description of the process used in a parliamentary system for removing the chief executive. An acceptable description includes the following:

  • Legislature gives vote of no confidence.

  • Party removal is internal party decision.
descriptions:
The student failed to provide a correct answer, an acceptable description includes the following:

  • Legislature gives vote of no confidence.

  • Party removal is internal party decision.

The student provided a correct answer, an acceptable description includes the following:

  • Legislature gives vote of no confidence.

  • Party removal is internal party decision.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Part (d): 1 point is earned for a contrast of the process described in part (c) with the process used in a presidential system for removing the chief executive. An acceptable contrast includes: legislature removes president. 

Note: The response must contrast with part (c) to earn a point; just mentioning impeachment is not enough to earn a point.
descriptions:
The student failed to provide a contrast of the process described in part (c) with the process used in a presidential system for removing the chief executive.

An acceptable contrast includes: legislature removes president.

The student response provided  a contrast of the process described in part (c) with the process used in a presidential system for removing the chief executive.

An acceptable contrast includes: legislature removes president.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Part (e): 1 point is earned for a description of a check on executive power within a parliamentary system. An acceptable description includes the following:

  • Cabinet resignation.

  • Backbencher resistance or revolt.

  • Question time.

  • Upper house can delay legislation.

  • Judiciary can overturn laws passed by the executive or parliament.

  • Parliament can refuse to pass legislation/budget proposed by the executive.

  • Must call for an election within a set time.

Note: Response earns no credit in part (e) for only stating “vote of no confidence.”
